intro: Polygala grondonae, commonly known as the Grondona's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
